intro: Quercus sutchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan oak, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its lobed leaves and acorn-producing cones. The tree typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing a rugged appearance. The species plays an important role in local ecosystems by supporting diverse wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
